info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rutland County through 800 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Poultney Village, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Castleton, Pawlet, Poultney Village, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Middletown Springs, Mt. Tabor, Danby, Proctor, Lake St. Catherine, Poultney, Fair Haven, West Rutland, Ira, Wells, Clarendon, Wallingford, Pittsford and Hubbardton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
